ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: For the needy and those dispossessed,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: for those that ask and those that are dispossessed,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: for the needy and the deprived,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: For those who beg, and for the needy who cannot even ask.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: For the one who asks, and for the deprived.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: For him who begs and for him who is denied (good)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: for the beggar and the outcast,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: For the beggar and the destitute;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: to those who ask [for help] and to the destitute;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: For the beggar and the destitute.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: for the beggar and the deprived,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: For the (needy) who asks and him who is prevented (for some reason from asking);
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: For the beggar who asks, and for the unlucky who has lost his property and wealth, (and his means of living has been straitened);
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: for the impoverished nonrequester and the requester,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: For the beggar and the deprived.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: For the petitioner and the deprived -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [70:25] for the beggar and the deprived, the [latter being the] one who refrains from begging and thus becomes deprived,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (For the beggar) who ask you to give him from your wealth (and the destitute) who is denied his wage or booty; it is also said that this refers to the artisan whose skill does not earn him enough for him to subsist; it is also said that this refers to the poor who does not beg from others and as a result no one gives or knows about him;
